content:
It takes a lot of courage to acknowledge that you need help and to take that first step in seeking professional support. It's great that you've been seeing Dr. Smith for three months now and that you're finding it helpful to talk through your anxiety and depression.

It's not uncommon for people to struggle with mental health issues for a while before seeking help. Sometimes, it takes a significant event or a "rock bottom" moment, like your breakdown, to realize that professional help is needed.

It's wonderful that you're taking proactive steps towards your mental health and wellness. Remember that therapy is a journey, and it's okay to take things one step at a time. It's a process, and it may take some time to work through your feelings and develop coping strategies.

Remember to be kind to yourself and celebrate your small wins along the way. It's amazing that you've taken the first step in seeking help, and that you're continuing to work on your mental health.

How has your experience been with Dr. Smith so far? Have you found that talking through your feelings and emotions has helped you gain any new insights or perspectives?
